subtitle: Everyone's favourite, this classic German-style recipe.

method.text: Sift together the flour and cocoa powder. Preheat oven to 180°C. Line and grease a 23 cm  / 9in cake tin.

Whisk the eggs and sugar together well until pale and fluffy over a pan of hot water. Keep whisking until it leaves the trail of the whisk and trebled in volume. Fold in the flour and cocoa powder then the butter and vanilla extract.
Pour into the cake tin. Bake for 40-45 min or until well risen. Leave in the tin to cool before placing onto a cooling tray.

Cut cake into thirds. Sprinkle over 15 ml cherry brandy, <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> can of cherries and 75ml cream. Repeat with second layer. Top with third cake round. Fold chocolate sauce into remaining cream and spread half over the sides and top of the cake.
Coat the sides with the grated chocolate. Decorate the top with cherries and swirls of remaining cream.

title: Black Forest gateau
